title.value: Substituting Data Annotation with Balanced Updates and Collective Loss in Multi-Label Text Classification
title.justification: The title is explicitly stated on the first page of the paper.
title.quote: Substituting Data Annotation with Balanced Updates and Collective Loss in Multi-Label Text Classification

extractions.description: The paper presents a framework, Balanced Neighbourhoods and Collective Loss (BNCL), for multi-label text classification (MLTC) in settings with either no annotations or limited annotations. The approach maps input text to label likelihoods using a pre-trained language model, updates these likelihoods based on a label dependency graph, and applies collective loss to refine predictions.

type.justification: The paper involves conducting multiple experiments to demonstrate the effectiveness of the proposed BNCL framework across different datasets and comparing it against several baseline methods.
type.quote: The experiments show that the proposed framework achieves effective performance under low supervision settings

name.justification: The paper addresses multi-label text classification (MLTC), which falls under the field of Natural Language Processing.
name.quote: Multi-label text classification (MLTC) is the task of selecting the correct subset of labels for each text sample in a corpus.
